channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19 wrap: 33 new cases as part of Waikato hit with a lockdown
item.description: Part of Waikato is joining Auckland in alert level 3; at least one testing station was swamped and Air New Zealand announces a 'no jab, no fly' policy.

item.title: Parent of baby in neonatal unit at Auckland City Hospital tests positive
item.description: The parent of a baby in the neonatal intensive care unit at Auckland City Hospital has tested positive, the Ministry of Health says.

item.title: Prime minister slates Destiny Church over 'illegal, morally wrong' gathering
item.description: The protest hosted by Destiny Church leader Brian Tamaki yesterday was "a slap in the face" for Aucklanders who were complying with level 3 rules, the prime minister says.

item.title: New Zealanders' favourite houseplants and how best to care for them
item.description: Cooped up in our homes during lockdown, New Zealanders have become increasingly obsessed with houseplants - and those who sell them say demand is higher than ever before.

item.title: Man charged with murder over fatal shooting in Avondale
item.description: A 24-year-old has been charged with murder after a man was fatally shot in the Auckland suburb of Avondale yesterday.

item.title: Main street of Ōtorohanga still closed as homicide inquiry continues
item.description: Police say a homicide in Ōtorohanga appears to be the result of a road rage incident.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for 3 October - everything you need to know
item.description: People are being turned away from a Waikato testing centre, despite being urged by the PM and Director General of Health to get tested. See how the day's news unfolded with RNZ's blog.

item.title: Covid-19 briefing: Waikato joins Auckland in alert level 3 from tonight
item.description: Parts of Waikato - including Raglan, Huntly, Ngāruawāhia and Hamilton City - will join Auckland in alert level 3 from midnight tonight, the Prime Minister has confirmed. Watch the latest government briefing here.

item.title: Multi-million Wgtn homeless hub build delayed, but on the way
item.description: The pandemic has delayed construction of a community hub planned to help Wellington's homeless.

item.title: Kāpiti businesses call for Transmission Gully opening date
item.description: Kāpiti businesses want a date locked in for the opening of the Transmission Gully motorway.

item.title: Covid-19 update: 33 new community cases reported in New Zealand
item.description: There have been 33 new community cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, with 15 still to be linked to earlier cases.

item.title: Australian takeover of Coromandel mine a 'Trojan horse' - conservation watchdog
item.description: A commercial mining company has purchased a hobby mine in Coromandel which it says has "significant potential to expand".

item.title: Air NZ to introduce 'no jab, no fly' policy for global flights
item.description: Air New Zealand is introducing a 'no jab, no fly' policy for international travellers, starting in February next year.

item.title: Panel calls for sweeping changes to maths teaching
item.description: An expert panel charged with reviewing the maths curriculum has exceeded its brief and called for a major overhaul of maths teaching in schools.

item.title: Confusion and frustration over dated but legal earthquake rules
item.description: New research shows there are tangled earthquake rules that could lead to owners strengthening the wrong parts of buildings, or having to pay twice to find out if their floors are safe.

item.title: Bad backs top list of most expensive health insurance claims
item.description: Surgery for bad backs has topped the list of most expensive surgical claims funded by Southern Cross Health Insurance this year, with the biggest claim hitting $222,000.

item.title: Two new Covid-19 community cases reported in Waikato
item.description: Two new Covid-19 cases have been reported in Waikato, with "a number of exposure events" the Ministry of Health has confirmed this morning.

item.title: ACC to spend $44.9 million on sexual violence prevention
item.description: ACC is spending nearly 45 million dollars on a bid to prevent sexual violence, including $11.7 million for kaupapa Māori approaches.
